problem_text:
Let M be a variety of groups and let G_r be a free r-generator group in M. A subset S ⊆ G_r is called a test set if every endomorphism of G_r identical on S is an automorphism. The minimum of the cardinalities of test sets is called the test rank of G_r. Suppose that the test rank of G_r is r for every r ⩾ 1.
a) Is it true that M is an abelian variety?
b) Suppose that M is not a periodic variety. Is it true that M is the variety of all abelian groups?
E. I. Timoshenko
